info.name: Best Practices in Cybersecurity
info.results: Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What is cryptography in computer science and what is its main objective?

a.option: It is the science that studies secret codes.
It is a branch of computer science that deals with communication security.
It is a set of techniques for encrypting and decrypting information.
It is a method for protecting data integrity.

questions.q: What are the two main types of cryptography?

a.option: Symmetric and asymmetric cryptography.
Public and private key cryptography.
Block and stream cryptography.
Hash and digital cryptography.

questions.q: How does symmetric cryptography differ from asymmetric cryptography?

a.option: Symmetric cryptography uses a single key for both encryption and decryption, while asymmetric cryptography uses two different keys.,
Symmetric cryptography is faster than asymmetric cryptography.
Asymmetric cryptography is more secure than symmetric cryptography.
Symmetric cryptography is only used for online communications, while asymmetric cryptography is used for data storage.

questions.q: What are some examples of symmetric and asymmetric encryption algorithms?

a.option: Symmetric: AES, DES. Asymmetric: RSA, ECC.
Symmetric: RSA, ECC. Asymmetric: AES, DES.
Symmetric: Hash, Digital. Asymmetric: Block, Stream.
There are no symmetric and asymmetric encryption algorithms.

questions.q: What is cryptography used for in computer science?

a.option: To protect the confidentiality of information.
To ensure data integrity.
To enable authentication of users and systems.
For all of the above.

questions.q: What is the primary goal of information security in an organization?

a.option: To protect the confidentiality, availability, and integrity of information.
To reduce operational costs.
To increase employee productivity.
To improve customer experience.

questions.q: What is the primary responsibility of users in information security?

a.option: To use secure and unique passwords for all accounts.
To keep the operating system and applications updated.
To report security incidents to the IT team.
All of the above.

questions.q: What is a good practice for protecting data on USB devices?

a.option: Formatear el dispositivo USB antes de usarlo.
Formatting the USB device before use.
Sharing the USB device with other users.
Storing confidential information on the USB device without protection..

questions.q: What is the principle of least privilege access?

a.option: Granting users the minimum access necessary to perform their tasks.
Granting users access to all organization systems and data.
Allowing users to change their own access permissions.
Restricting access to confidential information only to senior management.

questions.q: What is the best way to protect confidential data in case of laptop theft?

a.option: Using disk encryption software.
Storing confidential information in the cloud.
Sharing the laptop password with a coworker.
Taking no action, as laptop theft is inevitable.

questions.q: What is information and data privacy protection?

a.option: Practices and measures to safeguard information and data against unauthorized access, theft, loss, or misuse.
Set of laws regulating the use of the internet and social networks.
Techniques to improve network speed and performance.
Way to control access to personal data on social networks.

questions.q: What is data encryption and how does it contribute to information protection?

a.option: Process of converting data into an unreadable format to protect confidentiality.
Method for compressing data and saving storage space.
Técnica para eliminar datos sensibles de forma permanente.
System for creating data backups in the cloud.

questions.q: What is physical and logical access control and how is it implemented?

a.option: Set of measures to restrict access to physical and digital resources.
System for monitoring network traffic and detecting intrusions.
Method for authenticating users and devices on a network.
Tool for creating and managing secure passwords.

questions.q: What is the protection of confidential information and why is it important?

a.option: Practices to safeguard critical, sensitive, or strategically valuable information for the company.
Conjunto de leyes que regulan la protección de datos personales.
Technique for masking confidential data in a database.
System to control access to public information on the internet.

questions.q: What cybersecurity measures can be implemented to protect confidential information?

a.option: Data encryption, access control, identity and access management, auditing, and monitoring.
Using antivirus software and keeping the operating system up to date.
Creating data backups on an external hard drive.
Sharing passwords with colleagues to facilitate access to information.
